alert.note: Alert for Aransas; Kleberg; Nueces; San Patricio (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 22 at 11:36AM CDT until August 22 at 12:45PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTH CENTRAL ARANSAS, KLEBERG, NUECES AND SOUTHEASTERN SAN PATRICIO COUNTIES... At 1136 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Bands of very heavy rainfall from Tropical Storm Harold will be moving across the area. . Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Corpus Christi, Kingsville, Portland, Robstown, Port Aransas, Driscoll, Corpus Christi International Airport, Ingleside, Aransas Pass, Bishop, Gregory, Ingleside On The Bay, South Texas Botanical Gardens, Cabaniss Field, Kings Crossing Subdivision, Corpus Christi Country Club, Spohn Hospital South, La Palmera Mall, Bay Area Medical Center and Del Mar College Windward Campus. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
